title: (x) Panic.com T-shirt statements - FF Cocon {Tiff}
content:
I should probably know this, but I’m afraid it’s eluding me right now.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080209161248im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/mininfo-5_6459.gif)

Much Appreciation.

 [‹ (x) headline & body font Wired magazine spread - custom fonts by H&FJ {Chris Keegan}](http://web.archive.org/web/20080209161248/http:/www.typophile.com/node/33255 "Go to previous forum topic") [The Sage Group logo, similar to Brush Script ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080209161248/http:/www.typophile.com/node/33362 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Asvetic

comments.content:
Allude: To make an indirect reference: The candidate alluded to the recent war by saying, “We’ve all made sacrifices.”

Elude: to escape the understanding, perception, or appreciation of: The answer eludes me.

Thanks! Tiffany  
and uh, thanks. Patty

I’m just ribbing ya Patty, everyone loves a grammar lesson.
Yeah but since you fixed your text nobody’s gonna know why I stepped in.
Ha. Just don’t edit yours, Patty. I’ll back you up.
Thanks, ma’am. My schoolmarm side comes out every now and then. Comes from working in book publishing.

I love the edit comment feature! I wish it was on all forums I use.

For the record everyone... I used **Alluding not Eluding** originally.

What I do wish was included in the HTML, is Strikeout, so when I do edit, I can just strikeout the original and add the updated.
Oh we all love edit comment!
We all got that, it’s okay, it’s all clear to us, we’re not retarded. :^D :^P
